question: What was a notable achievement of the Special Report on Climate Change and Land by the IPCC, and what was a unique aspect of its production?
answer: The Special Report on Climate Change and Land broke new ground for the IPCC by being the first report to be produced by all three Working Groups in collaboration with the Task Force on National Greenhouse Gas Inventories (TFI), and it was also the first IPCC report with more authors from developing countries than authors from developed countries.
